attributes.action: Introduce free TfL travel for under-23s attending job interviews.
attributes.additional_details: Young Londoners face fierce competition for jobs, yet many are priced out before the interview. If we’re serious about social mobility, equal opportunity, no career should hinge on the cost of a train ticket. A free one-month TfL pass for job-seeking under-23s is not a handout but an investment in their future, their contribution to the economy, and London’s next generation. With fares at £6–15 per trip, travel is often unaffordable for the unemployed, having come out of education.
attributes.background: We’re calling for free TfL travel passes for under-23s attending in-person job interviews. Funded by government and run on GOV.UK and by TfL, the scheme would require proof of interview and be made a permanent support for young jobseekers.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly. 

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
